intro: Stachyarrhena acutiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stachyarrhena, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers that bloom in winter. Stachyarrhena acutiloba is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
